title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor when it is already opened in one editor, should show error message
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: Currently, when a file is opened in one editor, it can still be opened in another editor without any warning or error message.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message displayed when attempting to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

Currently, nothing happens when trying to open the file in another editor. However, the workbench should display a warning message saying that you may overwrite changes and ask if you want to continue, or display an error message stating that the file cannot be opened in another editor until it's closed in the current editor. We believe this is a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
